Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Rabbit Anti-Thymocyte Globulin in New-Onset Type 1 Diabetes

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, participants were new-onset type 1 diabetes patients recruited from multiple centers.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included age 12-35 years and diagnosis within 100 days.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive ATG or placebo.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the immunogenic response to ATG in new-onset type 1 diabetes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the development of anti-ATG antibodies, measured by ELISA at baseline, 1 month, and 1 year post-infusion.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to ATG and 100 to placebo.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 98 in the ATG group and 97 in the placebo group, using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference in IgG levels at 1 month was 2.5 units (95% CI 1.8 to 3.2; p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included serum sickness in 5% of the ATG group and none in the placebo group.
